comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The ropes appear to be looped around the trunk at various levels, so that they can simply be pulled off, once the tree is upright. 

An earlier stage in the 1913 tree-raising process:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4668744611/in/photostream/]

A different angle:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4626427047/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Interestingly, in most of these photographs of the tree-raising in Madison Square, there are, in fact, people in the tree either tying or releasing ropes.  None I could spot in this one, but I flagged some of the other photos with the people's locations.  They are only visible if you view the larger digital files over at the Library of Congress website by following the link at Persistent URL above.  Quite a job!
